instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed,
threads.message:
Got in a liquid damaged 3462. 
trackpad connector cable had corrosion and looked like <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_CUMULUS</SIGNAL> was eroded away on the cable. next to <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC</SIGNAL> so i suppose it had affected that line too.  Did ASD and its showing th1H SMC IO failed.

Checked <CHIP>U5550</CHIP> and its good.

Resistance on <RESISTOR>R5550</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R5551</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5552</RESISTOR> is also good. <RESISTOR>R5550</RESISTOR> seems to bounce around a lot but compared with another board and it seems to match up can you confirm that?  

any ideas? should i be looking into the <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC</SIGNAL> line? 
When it powers on fan is normal and then at about a quarter way through the osx boot up fans slowly turn to full.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed,
threads.message: If Th1h fails with IO error there must be more sensors failing, do ASD again. Crap under <CHIP>U5550</CHIP> or SMC is likely.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed,
threads.message: Ran asd 4 times now, With only the IO error. no th1h. tried replacing smc but i only had one donor board on hand and it seemed to be no good, so i put back on the old one for now. going to order some in.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed,
threads.message: Did you set ASD to continue on error, else it stops after the first error encountered.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed,
threads.message: yeah i set it to continue, first few times i tried to do it and it was running so slow i couldn't make it to continue before the drop bar closed.  My customer is willing to wait so i bought some more donors. and will test the smc when they arrive and post back unless you suspect it could be something else.?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed,
threads.message: It's not the SMC. Either <CHIP>U5550</CHIP> or one of the sensing transistors connected to it. So no donor needed as these parts are common on most boards.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed,
threads.message: I replaced <CHIP>U5550</CHIP>, R 5251 5250 5550 5552 5551 and C 2411 5552 5551 5550 and <TRANSISTOR>Q5501</TRANSISTOR> and still high fan speed.. what have i missed?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed,
threads.message: Remove <CHIP>U5550</CHIP> and see what errors ASD reports now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed,
threads.message: i wasn't paying attention this morning and pulled <CHIP>U7300</CHIP> and plugged the charger in and realized i messed up so i put it back on and then pulled <CHIP>U5550</CHIP> and now i have no video.  would pulling <CHIP>U7300</CHIP> and plugging it in affect my video?  also from the sounds of the fans after pulling the <CHIP>U5550</CHIP> the fans seem to go full speed at the same rate as before.  as soon as i can get my video back i will perform the asd.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed,
threads.message: Does it chime? If it doesn't chime I would imagine the RAM got 12v and this is toast.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed,
threads.message:
yeah no chime, i figured the same thing when i was looking into <CHIP>U7300</CHIP>.  i tried a pram reset also and now the only one fan spins on and off.  cant seem to get it back to spinning up anymore, should doing a pram reset make it stuck in this loop?   
I guess this is probably for the better because iv spent to much time on this one. 
Thanks for dropping in Louis! I should have know i fucked the ram when i did that :eek:

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed,
threads.message:
Voltage of <SIGNAL>PPDDR_S3_REG</SIGNAL>? The chip is probably just dead or not properly soldered back on. The system will happily try to go into S0 without this voltage being there as its not being checked as existing (afaik)

Unless you kept solder bridges on the board I do not think this can break the board.... The behaviour without this chip would be that the mosfet simply does not switch and thus not create any voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed,
threads.message: Yeah this board has been fried now without <CHIP>U7300</CHIP> probably.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed,
threads.message:
[QUOTE="smiba, post: 28291"]Voltage of <SIGNAL>PPDDR_S3_REG</SIGNAL>? The chip is probably just dead or not properly soldered back on. The system will happily try to go into S0 without this voltage being there as its not being checked as existing (afaik)

Unless you kept solder bridges on the board I do not think this can break the board.... The behaviour without this chip would be that the mosfet simply does not switch and thus not create any voltage.[/QUOTE]

[USER="289"]smiba[/USER] You were totally right bro! resoldered both <CHIP>U7300</CHIP> and <CHIP>U5550</CHIP> and everythings back to the way it was before.  good looking out man.  now will post back with new asd after i pull <CHIP>U5550</CHIP> again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed,
threads.message: Okay asd now reports TH1H, TH2H, TS0P,TP0P with <CHIP>U5550</CHIP> removed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed,
threads.message: TS0P would suggest you don't have the trackpad connected....Was this issue already fixed and you just did not have the trackpad connected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed,
threads.message:
actually i think your right duke, because the trackpad cable is messed up and this is for a local shop who is going to swap that on there own so i didn't bother to mess with it, normally i would have replaced it.  I will throw <CHIP>U5550</CHIP> back on and send it out and have the shop see if the issue is gone when they connect a new cable.  i wonder now if it was just the trackpad from the gecko  XD  
Will update after i confirm the issue with the customer 
Thanks for the help duke

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed,
threads.message: Run ASD and the only failing sensor should be TS0p.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed,
threads.message: now im getting TH1H sensor is reading above the high limit.  could this be from <CHIP>U5550</CHIP> not seated fully maybe? i did it in rush but it looked okay, but i haven't gotten this sensor error until now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan speed,
threads.message: Either bad soldering on <CHIP>U5550</CHIP> or dead <TRANSISTOR>Q5501</TRANSISTOR>/03
